episodeTitle: Come Back, Robin! Showdown with CP9!
episodeTitleJapanese: 帰って来いロビン！CP9との対決！
episodeTitleRomanized: Kaette Koi Robin! Shī-Pī Nain to no Taiketsu!
description: The Straw Hats confront CP9 and plead with Robin to return to the crew, but she refuses, stating she cannot achieve her goals while staying with them. The true identities of Lucci, Kaku, Kalifa, and Blueno as CP9 agents are revealed, shocking Paulie and the crew. Lucci demonstrates his deadly Rokushiki techniques and reveals a glimpse of his leopard transformation.

events.title: Robin Refuses to Return to the Crew
events.description: Luffy and the Straw Hats desperately ask Robin to come back to the crew, but she firmly refuses, stating that she cannot accomplish her wish if she stays with them. This devastating rejection reveals Robin's internal conflict and her decision to sacrifice herself to protect the crew from CP9 and the World Government's threat.
events.significance: This is a pivotal moment in the Water 7 saga where Robin's self-sacrificing nature is revealed. Her refusal sets up the emotional core of the Enies Lobby arc and demonstrates the depth of her trauma and her willingness to give up everything to protect her newfound family.

quotes.text: I cannot accomplish my wish if I stay with you!
quotes.speaker: Nico Robin
quotes.context: Robin's heartbreaking refusal to return to the Straw Hat crew

events.title: CP9 Identities Revealed to the Straw Hats
events.description: The Straw Hats and Paulie are shocked to learn that Lucci, Kaku, Kalifa, and Blueno are actually CP9 agents who have been undercover in Water 7 for five years. The trusted shipwrights and secretary are revealed to be elite government assassins with the mission to obtain the Pluton blueprints.
events.significance: This revelation is a major turning point that exposes the true antagonists of the Water 7 saga. The betrayal deepens the arc's themes of trust and deception, and introduces the formidable CP9 as opponents who have been hiding in plain sight.

quotes.text: We are CP9, a secret intelligence agency of the World Government.
quotes.speaker: Rob Lucci
quotes.context: Lucci reveals their true identities to the shocked Straw Hats and Paulie

events.title: Paulie's Shock at His Colleagues' Betrayal
events.description: Paulie is devastated to discover that his trusted colleagues and friends—Lucci, Kaku, Kalifa, and Blueno—are actually CP9 agents who have been deceiving everyone at Galley-La for years. His shock and sense of betrayal are palpable as he realizes they attempted to assassinate Iceburg.
events.significance: This moment humanizes the conspiracy and shows the personal cost of CP9's deception. Paulie's emotional reaction emphasizes the depth of the betrayal and the ruthlessness of the World Government's methods.

quotes.text: You guys... I thought you were my friends!
quotes.speaker: Paulie
quotes.context: Paulie's devastated reaction to learning his coworkers are CP9 agents

events.title: Paulie's Pipe Hitch Knives Debut
events.description: Paulie attacks Rob Lucci using his signature Rope Action technique: Pipe Hitch Knives. He launches a rope with a spiraling row of knives tied to it in an attempt to strike down the CP9 leader. Despite his skill with rigging and knots, the attack proves ineffective against Lucci's superior abilities.
events.significance: This showcases Paulie's fighting style and his courage in standing up to CP9 despite being outmatched. It establishes the power gap between the shipwrights and the elite assassins.

events.title: Lucci's Shigan Technique Used Against Paulie
events.description: Rob Lucci demonstrates the deadly Rokushiki technique Shigan (Finger Gun) by thrusting his finger through Paulie with the force of a bullet, causing severe damage. This is the first time the Straw Hats witness the terrifying power of the Six Powers martial arts used by CP9.
events.significance: This moment establishes the lethality of Rokushiki techniques and demonstrates Lucci's ruthless efficiency as an assassin. It shows the Straw Hats that they face opponents far more dangerous than any they've encountered in the East Blue or Paradise.

quotes.speaker: Rob Lucci
quotes.context: Lucci uses his deadly finger strike technique on Paulie

events.title: Blueno's Kami-e Technique Demonstrated
events.description: Blueno demonstrates the Rokushiki technique Kami-e (Paper Art), which allows him to make his body as flexible as paper to dodge attacks. He uses this defensive technique to evade attacks from the Straw Hats, showcasing another aspect of CP9's martial arts mastery.
events.significance: This introduces another Rokushiki technique and demonstrates the versatility of CP9's combat abilities. It shows that the CP9 agents possess both offensive and defensive superhuman techniques.

events.title: Lucci's Leopard Transformation Silhouette Revealed
events.description: Rob Lucci reveals that he possesses a Devil Fruit ability by beginning to transform into his Zoan form. A silhouette shows him transforming into a leopard hybrid, hinting at the immense power of the Neko Neko no Mi, Model: Leopard. The episode ends with this cliffhanger transformation.
events.significance: This is the first reveal of Lucci's Devil Fruit power and establishes him as an even more dangerous opponent. The combination of Rokushiki mastery and Zoan Devil Fruit abilities makes Lucci one of the most formidable enemies the Straw Hats have faced. This sets up his role as Luffy's primary antagonist in the upcoming Enies Lobby arc.

events.title: Robin Escapes from Galley-La
events.description: While the Straw Hats are held back by the CP9 agents, Nico Robin successfully escapes from the room. Despite Luffy's desperate attempts to reach her, the CP9 agents block his path, allowing Robin to leave. She walks away from the crew, adhering to her deal with CP9 to protect her friends.
events.significance: Robin's escape marks the completion of her separation from the crew and sets the stage for the rescue mission that becomes the Enies Lobby arc. This moment crystallizes the central conflict and emotional stakes of the Water 7 saga.

events.title: Straw Hats vs CP9 Confrontation Begins
events.description: The Straw Hat Pirates engage in combat with the CP9 agents in an attempt to reach Robin. Luffy, Zoro, Nami, and Chopper fight against Lucci, Kaku, Kalifa, and Blueno, but are overwhelmed by the agents' superior Rokushiki techniques. This marks the first direct combat between the crews.
events.significance: This confrontation establishes the power dynamic and shows that the Straw Hats are not yet strong enough to defeat CP9. It motivates their growth and sets up the training and power-ups that will be necessary for the battles at Enies Lobby.

events.title: Rokushiki Martial Arts Introduced
events.description: The episode introduces Rokushiki, the Six Powers martial arts style used by CP9 agents. This superhuman fighting technique includes moves like Shigan (Finger Gun), Kami-e (Paper Art), and other abilities that give CP9 members combat prowess beyond normal humans without Devil Fruit powers.
events.significance: The introduction of Rokushiki expands the world-building by showing that powerful techniques exist outside of Devil Fruits and Haki. It establishes CP9 as elite fighters and introduces a martial arts system that will be important throughout the Water 7 and Enies Lobby arcs.

quotes.text: This is Rokushiki, the Six Powers!
quotes.speaker: Rob Lucci
quotes.context: Explaining the superhuman martial arts techniques used by CP9

quotes.text: I cannot accomplish my wish if I stay with you!
quotes.speaker: Nico Robin
quotes.context: Robin's heartbreaking refusal to return to the Straw Hat crew

quotes.text: We are CP9, a secret intelligence agency of the World Government.
quotes.speaker: Rob Lucci
quotes.context: Lucci reveals their true identities to the shocked Straw Hats and Paulie

quotes.text: You guys... I thought you were my friends!
quotes.speaker: Paulie
quotes.context: Paulie's devastated reaction to learning his coworkers are CP9 agents

quotes.speaker: Rob Lucci
quotes.context: Lucci uses his deadly finger strike technique on Paulie

quotes.text: This is Rokushiki, the Six Powers!
quotes.speaker: Rob Lucci
quotes.context: Explaining the superhuman martial arts techniques used by CP9

themes.description: Robin's refusal to return to the crew demonstrates her willingness to sacrifice her own happiness and freedom to protect her friends from the World Government's wrath. She denies herself the family she's always wanted because she believes it's the only way to keep them safe.
themes.symbolism: Robin walking away from the crew represents her isolation and the burden of her past, while the Straw Hats reaching out to her symbolizes the bonds of friendship that she's trying to sever for their sake.

themes.description: The revelation that Lucci, Kaku, Kalifa, and Blueno are CP9 agents who have been deceiving everyone in Water 7 for five years explores themes of trust and betrayal. Paulie's shock at learning his friends are actually enemies highlights the personal cost of such deception.
themes.symbolism: The masks that CP9 metaphorically wore while working in Water 7 represent the hidden face of the World Government and its ruthless methods.

themes.description: The introduction of CP9 and Rokushiki techniques establishes a clear power hierarchy, showing that the Straw Hats have entered a new tier of challenges. The World Government's elite agents represent institutional power and authority.
themes.symbolism: The superhuman abilities of Rokushiki symbolize the gulf between the pirates and the World Government's military might.

themes.description: Despite Robin's refusal, the Straw Hats' determination to get her back demonstrates the strength of their bonds. Luffy's desperation to reach Robin shows that the crew won't abandon her, even when she tries to push them away.
themes.symbolism: The physical barrier created by CP9 between Luffy and Robin represents the obstacles that stand between them, but also the challenge that must be overcome to restore their friendship.

characterSpotlights.development: Robin's refusal to return reveals the depth of her trauma and her self-sacrificing nature. She believes that leaving the crew is the only way to protect them from the World Government's wrath, showing her willingness to give up her dream of finding a place to belong.
keyActions: Refuses Luffy's plea to return to the crew
States she cannot accomplish her wish while staying with them
Escapes from Galley-La while CP9 holds back the Straw Hats
quotes: I cannot accomplish my wish if I stay with you!

characterSpotlights.development: Lucci is revealed as the leader of the CP9 agents in Water 7. His cold demeanor, deadly Rokushiki techniques, and Devil Fruit transformation establish him as one of the most formidable opponents the Straw Hats have faced.
keyActions: Reveals CP9's true identity to the Straw Hats
quotes: We are CP9, a secret intelligence agency of the World Government.
This is Rokushiki, the Six Powers!

characterSpotlights.development: Paulie's world is shattered when he learns that his trusted colleagues were actually CP9 agents all along. His emotional reaction humanizes the conspiracy and shows the personal cost of CP9's five-year undercover mission.
keyActions: Reacts with shock and devastation to the CP9 reveal
Attempts to fight Lucci with Pipe Hitch Knives
Is severely injured by Lucci's Shigan technique
quotes: You guys... I thought you were my friends!

characterSpotlights.role: Determined captain trying to save his nakama
characterSpotlights.development: Luffy refuses to accept Robin's departure and desperately tries to reach her. His determination to get Robin back, even when she pushes him away, demonstrates the strength of his loyalty to his crew members.
keyActions: Pleads with Robin to return to the crew
Fights against CP9 to try to reach Robin
Refuses to give up despite Robin's rejection

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended the confrontation scenes between the Straw Hats and CP9 with additional action sequences not present in the manga.
The anime shows Chopper's second eyecatcher design, which is an anime-original addition.

trivia.fact: This is the final episode to use 'Eternal Pose' by Asia Engineer as the ending theme. The song had been used since Episode 231.
This episode introduced Chopper's second eyecatcher design in the anime.
The episode adapts content from manga chapters 347 (pages 4-19) and 348 (pages 2-19).
Rob Lucci's leopard transformation is only shown in silhouette in this episode, with the full reveal coming in Episode 246. This cliffhanger ending was designed to build anticipation.

The Rokushiki techniques introduced in this episode are based on real-world martial arts concepts, with names that translate to poetic descriptions like 'Finger Gun' (Shigan) and 'Paper Art' (Kami-e).
